title: T-sans, which font foundry produces theis font and where can i get it
content:
Hey everybuddy,

A client of our uses T-sans as corporate typeface, very nice!  
But i can’t find it on the net?

Which font foundry produces theis font and where can i get it.

 [‹ What would Frutiger look like if we added weird semi serifs around and space it really tight?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034036/http:/typophile.com/node/50275 "Go to previous forum topic") [what are some fun/flowing Display Script Typefaces? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034036/http:/typophile.com/node/50287 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Timid_and_friendly

comments.content:
Hi David,

I assume it’s [TheSans](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034036/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TheSans) by [Luc(as) de Groot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034036/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Luc%252528as%252529%252Bde%252BGroot)?  
The Thesis fonts can be purchased via his own outlet, [LucasFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034036/http:/www.lucasfonts.com/), or via [FontShop](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034036/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=thesans), alternatively.  
F

You are right! It was TheSans.

I was given the wrong name. Thx for your help!
